body.name: Linksys WiFi 5 Router, Dual-Band, 1,500 Sq. ft Coverage, 10+ Devices, Parental Control, Supports Guest WiFi, Speeds up to (AC1200) 1.2Gbps - E5400
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery February 20 - 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Work Uninterrupted: Stay connected with a home WiFi that can handle the load. The router eliminates possible dead zones for stable signals up to 1.2 Gbps from room to room.
Loads Better: With ultra-low latency for lag-free gaming, streaming and binging TV shows. Connect game consoles, smartphones, computers & smart home devices with fast WiFi.
Kid-Safe Internet: Enable Parental Control feature to set time limits, schedule time-specific WiFi access, and restrict websites on kids' devices so they can browse safely online.
Simple Setup: The browser-based setup provides clear visual instructions of the entire process so you can get online in minutes. Set separate guest access to keep the network safe.
Secure Privacy: Blocks internet safety threats with WPA2 wireless encryption & SPI firewall systems. With 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports for fast data transfer & high network throughput.
body.description: "See How Your WiFi Can Work for You The Linksys E5400 Dual Band WiFi 5 Router brings a powerful upgrade to your network system, providing dependable internet signals throughout your home for multiple wireless devices. Work from home efficiently with a stable and consistently fast WiFi. Get Things Done with The Right Connection The Beamforming technology efficiently reduces network congestions and allocates dedicated fast signals up to 1.2 Gbps to multiple devices simultaneously. Everyone gets their share of reliable connection so work-from-home setup, virtual classes, and streaming go uninterrupted. Setup Is a Breeze The Linksys browser-based setup provides clear visual instructions of the installation process. Once connected, easily personalize & manage your network. The router connects to your existing modem. Keep Kids Safe Online Stay on top of what your kids are accessing online. With Parental Control feature, set time limits, schedule WiFi access, and restrict explicit contents from your kids' devices. Guest Access Create separate guest access for your visitors to keep your network private and safe. Caters Every Home Style: - Bungalow-Style House - Single-Story Home - Multi-Story Town Home - L-Shaped Home"

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The product is easy to install and very stable. There should be some leds indicating power and signal. Other than that, it's a wonderfull device. I will order some more.

reviews.reviewerName: Jack of all trades, Master of Some
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Top Notch! Works awesome!
reviews.reviewText: No more Xfinity kickouts when you go idle for 5 seconds! This Linksys router solved all our household Wi-fi internet connection issues. Xfinity's wifi modem kicks you off if you go idle for even a few seconds (to save them millions in costs) and this device eliminated that problem. Strong, solid signal. All bars are showing anywhere in and around the house within the modem stated range in square feet. It doesn't matter if you're in the first or second floor, the basement, or outside the house. Great deal for the money! The only negative I can say is that it took a 5 or 10 minutes to set up, because it took a minute for everything to update where I could access the router page on the internet to finalize the settings. But I think that's generally true of all Wi-Fi routers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good cheap browser, 5Ghz range is too short, 2.4 Ghz is better
reviews.reviewText: As the headline, it is a good Linksys router, easy to configure. Like that the 5 Ghz and 2.4 Ghz bands have different names (even though you can change it of course). Easier this way to setup fast devices, with only 2.4 Ghz ones like smart plugs and WIFI garage doors.The 5 Ghz signal range is very short. You need to be close to the equipment to use it. If you are rooms away it becomes very poor and you would need to rely on the 2.4 Ghz one. But if you need a cheap reliable router then it is OK overall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive with 2.4 and 5 ghz wifi.
reviews.reviewText: It's a nice little router with 2.4 and 5 ghz wifi had guest account capability. I have it as a router behind a router. My main router is wired only and this adds both wired and wireless capability to my network. Setting this up was straightforward. Instructions can be found on the internet. I have been using it now for months and noted that I have very few wifi drop outs. My old wifi router was losing connection with a fairly consistent frequency.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Do Not Buy Used; NO gigabit ethernet WAN support; terrible Linksys tech support
reviews.reviewText: Where do I start? If I hadn't been configuring Linksys routers since about 1998, I would have been hosed.1) I purchased this router USED from the Linksys store. However, the morons forgot to clear the previous owner's settings, meaning not only could I not enter the zone passwords and names, I could also not even log into the control panel to enter the changes;2) I figured a quick IM to their tech support could tell me what I was doing wrong, as this was the first time in a decade I set up a Linksys router, so I was a bit rusty. Ironically, although Linksys claims the router will not work until configured, in fact it picked up the DHCP broadcast from Comcast via my DOCSIS 3.0 Surfboard, and NAT worked correctly, creating a Class C subnet with DHCP broadcasts.Although I was #4 in the queue, there was about a 10 minute wait to reach a tech. What happened once I got connected to a "tech" was a 30+ minute exchange with a total MORON who could not comprehend my problem, despite REPEATED explanations, even asking me why I want to get into the configuration pages TO BEGIN WITH, that I should use the "Wizard." Since I had now invested 40 MINUTES(!) with this "tech," I told him "screw it, I'll do a hard reset, and we may get disconnected." So, I performed a hard reset (pressed the red recessed reset button on the bottom for 20 seconds); and was able to log into 192.168.1.1 and use the default password, which brought up the wizard, which is actually pretty good; though I needed to tweak a few settings manually.Surprisingly, I did not lose connection with the "tech," so I let him have it before disconnecting with that schmuck;3) Much to my surprise, this router has only fast ethernet (100 Mbit) ports... INCLUDING THE WAN PORT!? You may get 1.2 Gb from one wireless device to another (why) but this thing caps out at 95 Mbit on the web. Why would Linksys (Belkin) build a WiFi 5 wireless router with "Speeds up to 1.2 Gb" and then skip the gigabit ethernet?! With my Surfboard showing 60 Mbit running the excellent speed test at DSLreports•com (a tool I've used for 20+ years) plugged directly into my PC (i.e. sans router), the ethernet speed is not an issue—But if you have a faster connection, say, gigabit fiber or cable, IT WILL BE.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does As Advertised
reviews.reviewText: Simple to set up, no problems, puts out a signal sufficient for a five room apartment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I liked it but it was a gift.I guess it’s working fine, I haven’t got a call to say anything negative about it. 🤷🏼‍♀️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars received 'new' item already configured and unusable (until factory reset)
reviews.reviewText: i have mediacom and mediacom is terrible so i ordered my own modem and router. when i received this router it was already configured with someone else's SSID and the admin password had changed so i was unable to connect or configure it myself. i did a factory reset so i was able to use it and it seems like a decent product but if you pay for something brand new, it should arrive brand new. linksys tech support is awful, but that's not really relevant here just something to keep in mind if you purchase a linksys product and need any kind of support.otherwise it seems like it does what it advertises and is a good product for the price, hence the 3 stars instead of 1 or 2. i did return/replace and the replacement will be here in a couple days, if that one is clearly not new either, the rating may change.
O equipamento é excelente, com uma excelente cobertura e muito fácil de configurar.
Muy bueno, la señal es muy estable y permite dos señales, se puede configurar para que se conecten por IP o dirección MAC.
Sencillo de configurar; buen alcance, compacto... muy muy recomendable.
Fácil de configurar y ofrece las 2 frecuencias de wi-fi, lo malo es que la red 5g solo ofrece a lo más 90mbps. De repente se desconectan mis equipos de la red.
